title: Botswana - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 25 December 2020, a man was beaten and injured by police officers and members of the armed forces after they dispersed a group behind a bar in Mochudi (Kgatleng, Kgatleng). He was taken to a police station and released, but was not allowed to report the event or get a medical report from the authorities.
The Namibian; New Era; Namibia Broadcasting; GardaWorld; Windhoek Observer

On 5 November 2020, 3 Namibians and 1 Zambian fishermen were killed by members of the Botswana armed forces in the Chobe River (Chobe, Chobe). Botswana authorities claimed that the victims were poachers, a fact denied by their families, who claimed that they were executed.

Around 5 October 2020 (as reported), a group of 40 female lawyers danced in front of the High Court in Gaborone (Gaborone, South-East) to raise awareness against gender-based violence, and to raise funds for the cause. [size=40]

On 28 September 2020, Botswana International University of Science and Technology students were injured as riot police fired teargas canisters inside their rooms in Palapye (Palapye, Central). The students had announced a strike against the BIUST varsity's management. 6 students were injured.

On 8 September 2020, students from the Moshupa secondary school attacked teachers and damaged property, including cars, in Mosopa (Ngwaketsi, Southern). The motivation for the violence was unknown. No reports on injuries. [size=no report]

On 25 July 2020, a man was shot by a rubber bullet and seriously injured by police officers in Gaborone (Gaborone, South-East) after the group was approached for not obeying coronavirus-related rules.

On 27 June 2020, 4 safari guides were beaten by 4 anti-poaching soldiers and 2 wildlife officers in the Okavango Delta's NG32 area (North-West). The victims were suspects in using a vehicle with mismatching registration number plates and were accused of poaching.

On 9 May 2020, around 30 local residents staged a demonstration outside the home of the councillor in Boswelakoko/Saint Paul ward near Molepolole (Kweneng) to demand food relief hampers during the coronavirus lockdown. [size=around 30]
On or around 26 January 2020, a Zimbabwean national was fatally assaulted in Gaborone by community members who accused him of pickpocketing. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2020, a mob attacked a man and a village chief who they accused of murdering another man in the community. The incident came after the body of a man was found who were missing since December in Paje village. Four people were injured by the village chief and 39 arrested. [size=at least 43]
On 5 January 2020, a mob beat to death a young man after he was allegedly caught stealing at Mogoditshane's Senthumole ward in Mogoitshane (Kweneng South, Kweneng). [size=no report]
On 5 January 2020, a mob killed a man suspected of stealing a vehicle in Senthumule ward in Mogoditshane. [size=no report].

Around 15 December 2019 (month of), a young man was beaten and left with scars after a mob attacked him in Mogoditshane (Kweneng South, Kweneng). He was allegedly targeted for having links to a youth with a criminal history in the village. [size=no report]

19 August. Demonstrations have been reported the Gaborone University College of Law and Professional Studies (GUC). The demonstration is over a lack of lecturers, delayed allowance payments and overcrowding. [size=no report].

15 August (on or around). Students from the University of Botswana, Gaborone, have been demonstrating at the university for four days over the late payment of allowances and the shortage in accommodation. [size=no report].

On 14 August 2019, students from the University of Botswana, Gaborone, staged four days of demonstrations at the university over the late payment of allowances and the shortage in accommodation. [size=no report]

On 13 August 2019, students from the University of Botswana, Gaborone, staged four days of demonstrations at the university over the late payment of allowances and the shortage in accommodation. [size=no report]

On 12 August 2019, students from the University of Botswana, Gaborone, staged four days of demonstrations at the university over the late payment of allowances and the shortage in accommodation. [size=no report]

On 20 July 2019, mine workers along with the BMWU demonstrated at the Gaborone International Convention Centre during the 50th anniversary of Debswana mining company. The demonstrators were demanding a bonus increase. [size=no report]

17 July. Residents from Selebi Phikwe held a peaceful demonstration to put pressure on the District Commissioner to deal with the earth tremors in the town that is being caused by underground shifts at the now closed BCL mine. [size=no report].
On 19 June 2019, students marched to the Department of Tertiary Education Funding Office in Gaborone to demand that their allowances be paid. [size=no report]

On 18 June 2019, five University of Botswana students were arrested for blocking the entrance of the Department of Tertiary Education Financing, to demand that their allowances be paid. [size=at least 5]
On or around 26 April 2019, residents from Jackalas No1 village marched to hand over a petition to the member of parliament due to a persistent water crisis in the area. [size=no report]
06 February. Students from the University of Botswana protested at the university over the delayed welfare allowance payments.
On 21 November (exact date unknown) , disgruntled employees of United Refineries Botswana stormed owning MP's constituency office demanding payment.
On 9 October, Mokolodi residents barricaded the road leading to the quarry in protest against the pollution and dust caused by construction tipper trucks that pass through the residential area.
On 3 October, a peaceful demonstrations by students took place at the University of Botswana in Gaborone.

End September/early October, a man was killed by an angry mob that attacked him near Sedumedi JSS after being found with electric cables inside his bag, which they alleged he had stolen from inside people's houses
On 9 October, Mokolodi residents barricaded the road leading to the quarry in protest against the pollution and dust caused by construction tipper trucks that pass through the residential area.

On 18 June 2018, a group of 12 refugees from Namibia demonstrated in front of SADC headquarters in Gaborone, demanding their grievances be addressed over a decision to repatriate the refugees to Namibia next month. The demonstrators are demanding the Namibian government to unban the United Democratic Party (UDP), which carried out deadly secessionist attacks. [size=12]

On 19 June 2018, a group of 12 refugees from Namibia demonstrated for the second day, in front of SADC headquarters in Gaborone, demanding their grievances be addressed over a decision to repatriate the refugees to Namibia next month. The demonstrators are demanding the Namibian government to unban the United Democratic Party (UDP), which carried out deadly secessionist attacks. [size=12]

On 28 May, a group of unemployed teacher graduates that marched to the Ministry of Basic Education in Gaborone to hand over a petition has given Minister Bagalatia Arone 20 days to have responded to their demands.
BOFEPUSU: Botswana Federation of Public Parastatal and Private Sector Union
On 28 March, Botswana Federation of Public Parastatal and Private Sector Unions (BOFEPUSU) held a demonstration against corruption in Gaborone
On 24 May, a young man from Mandunyane village suspected to be a robber and rapist was beaten by mob. He survived.
On 4 April, residents of Tlokweng protested an illegal water siphoning connection attached to the Notwane river system by Iranian born real estate magnate.

On 6 March, student riots took place at the Botho University main campus in Gaborone. The student's riots at Botho follows last month's protests over book allowances and accreditation of courses offered by the institution.
On 4 February, religious followers, together with the police, mobilised the public in a march against murder in Kgatleng.

Unemployed youth peacefully picketed the Botswana Parliament. Armed police demanded that the youth disperse and then began to arrest and beat them. A journalist was arrested for refusing to delete footage of the police violence. No injuries reported.
A group of women staged a sit-in protest at the SADC headquarters in Gaborone in Botswana.

Students at Gabarone Technical College and Francistown College of Technical Education rioted on Feb 22 over non-payment of allowances and issues of accreditation - erected barricades, pulled students from class.

Students at Gabarone Technical College and Francistown College of Technical Education rioted on Feb 22 over non-payment of allowances and issues of accreditation - erected barricades, pulled students from class.
Rioters threw stones, burned tyres, and destroyed a shopping centre in protest of four men being on trial for allegedly murdering a woman. Police arrested 5.
Churches in Kumakwane staged a march against gender based violence.
Botswana police detain and beat Zimbabwean immigrants with canes, causing severe injuries.

Property destruction: Botswana Defence Forces raided and burned four temporary fishing camps villages in Linyanti, where BDF claimed Namibian fishermen were conducting illegal fishing. Several arrested.

Rioters gathered at the Oodi sub-land board to submit applications for residential land plots. They spent the night in the queue and brought down the main gate of the offices and broke windows during the night.
Protesters gathered at different land boards in Kgatleng District to submit applications for residential land plots.
YWCA silent protest march to end gender-based violence.

Kalahari Bushmen protested at an election rally for President Ian Khama over their right to hunt on traditional lands. Khama has been criticized for attempts to force the Bushmen out of the reserve while allowing fracking exploration and a diamond mine on the land.
On 13 March 2014, a man was arrested for trading in elephant tusks. He accused police of torturing him during his arrest in Maun.
After a football game, minor riots erupted at the stadium. A football assaulted a journalist for taking his photo.
Violent protests by Botswanas public service workers, who are embroiled in a wage dispute with President Ian Khamas government.

Botswanas striking government employees caused public disorder in the African countries second city Francistown on Tuesday as thousands of strikers barricaded roads with burning tires. According to local radio GABZ, the striking workers in the city took to the streets, barricading roads, burning tires and even throwing stones at passing cars. The police had to use tear gas to disperse the rioters, some workers have been arrested by the police.

Police in Botswana fired tear gas on rioting students angry over a teachers strike. Teachers union secretary Justin Hunyepa says the students rioted in Molepolole, some 30 miles (50 kilometers) outside Gaborone, on Friday. He says 95 per cent of teachers are on strike nationwide
A vigilante mob attacks a group of armed robbers after they rob a house.
Defusal: Police discover an explosive outside the Presidents residence, detonate it in a controlled setting.
The BNF protests the extra-judicial killing of civilians by security agents.
Police shoot and kill a 27 year-old robber.
Bushmen, recently evicted by former president Festus Mogae, protest the fact he received an 'Achievement In Africa Leadership Award.'
A man is stabbed to death in the Phase IV area of the city.
Retailers stage a protest after the government of Gaborone outlawed the use of plastic bags by retailers and shopkeepers in an environmental effort.
A man attempts to hijack an Air Botswana flight en route from Gaborone to Johannesburg, but is not successful. He was arrested in Johannesburg upon arrival.
150 members of an opposition group, the BNF, hold a protest march against government moves to relocate bushmen from their land on a gaming reserve.

Protesters against the rampant passion killings in Botswana marched from Bontleng to Parliament to present a petition to President Festus Mogae, urging him to take steps to make the county safer for woman and girls.
Bushmen protest a forced relocation by the government. Police arrest 20, use rubber bullets to disperse the others.
Bushmen protest a forced relocation by the government. Police arrest 20, use rubber bullets to disperse the others.
Street traders defy a city ordanance/police order to move their places of business, clash with police.
About 2000 street vendors demonstrated in a march against the Gaborone City Council over police harassment and government policies that neglect the informal sector.

Students at Gaborone Technical College went on strike demanding that the college terminate the services of the security company employing the guards. Riot police were called in, a shot was fired, and many were injured as students fled

The Botswana Mining Workers Union (BMWU) demonstrated to voice their grievances against biased Industrial Court rulings that favour employers, and unfair 2004/2005 wage negotiations and the government salary review
BNF-Concerned Group: Botswana National Front Party (Concerned Group Faction)
Botswana National Front (BNF) supporters marched to protest the ruling Botswana Democratic Party (BDP), alleging acts of corruption and misuse of state media

At least five Zimbabwean commuter buses had their windows and windshields stoned when a scuffle between police and a suspected Zimbabwean citizen trying to evade arrest turned into a riot between Zimbabweans and Batswana at the Gaborone Bus Rank.
UBSRC: University of Botswana Student Representative Council; Students (Botswana)
University of Botswana (UB) students took to the streets to protest against insufficient off campus allowances, submitting a petition to the Ministry of Education and the UB administration
Thousands of Muslims march in protest of the plans of the United States to invade Iraq.
University of Botswana protest the implication of the president that the student body there is heavily infected with AIDS.
BNF-Concerned Group: Botswana National Front Party (Concerned Group Faction)
BNF-Concerned Group: Botswana National Front Party (Concerned Group Faction)

Rioting broke out at a weekend Botswana National Front opposition party conference over the suspension of a dissident BNL faction. Protesters threw stones at cars and fought with other delegates. Several people were hospitalized
Three hundred Zambians resident in Botswana yesterday rallied at high commissioner Milton Phiris residence in Gaborone in support of the MMD government in Zambia, condemning the coup attempt

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is South-East with 43 reports followed by Central with 10 reports.
The largest admin2 is Gaborone with 42 reports followed by Kweneng South with 8 reports.
The largest admin1 is South-East with 43 reports followed by Central with 10 reports.
